titleStmt.title: Program for Baby Week by City Federation of Colored Women's Clubs. March 5-11, 1916. Jacksonville, Florida.
titleStmt.author: City Federation of Colored Women's Clubs

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: A program for Baby Week held from March 5 to 11, 1916 that is sponsored by the City Federation of Colored Women's Clubs.

objectDesc.p: A typewritten program on a single sheet of paper.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.head:
Under Auspices of the City Federa-
tion of Women's Clubs.

div.p:
Sunday, March 5th––Sermons on the Baby by Pastors of various
Churches.
Monday beginning at 2 P. M. and all day Tuesday––Visiting the
State Educational Health Exhibit Car. (Cor.Corner Lee and Forsyth Sts.Streets)
Wednesday from 2 to 5 P. M.—Baby Show. At the Bethel Baptist
Institutional church (corner Caroline and Hogan Sts.Streets) 6 Prizesprizes will be
awarded for the finest Babybaby from 1 month to 5 years old.
Wednesday at 8 P. M.––Health Meeting, at same place.
Thursday––Special Pictures at the Strand Theatre to assist Infint Wel-
fare Fund. 5c.5 cents to all.
Friday and Saturday from 9 to 2 P. M.––Free Clinic at Woman’s
Club (East Duval St.Street) Bring Babiesbabies from 1 months to 2 years old
during the hours from 9 to 1 both days.

Tags will be sold during the entire week. Proceeds for the Infint Wel-
fare Fund.

Miss Ertha M. M. White, President.
Miss C. S. Tucker and Mrs. Anna Sightler, Sec'ysSecretaries.
Mrs. J. W. Ward, TreasTreasurer.
Miss M. Allen, City Nurse.
Florida Printing Co., 40 E.East Union St.Street
